fields.value: Long-run dynamics of the US patent classification system

dsDescriptionValue.value: The dataset contains several files used in the paper "Long-run dynamics of the US patent classification system" by Fran√ßois Lafond and Daniel Kim. The files contain data on the evolution of the number of classes in the United States Patent Classification System between 1836 and 2015, data on the original (at grant date) and current (2015) primary classification at the class level of patents granted between 1976 and 2015, and related supporting files.

publicationCitation.value: Lafond, F. and Kim, D., 2018. Long-run dynamics of the US patent classification system, Journal of Evolutionary Economics, forthcoming.

files.description: class2description.txt gives class numbers and description
files.label: class2description.txt

files.description: PatentsClassesN.csv: Number of classes in the historical classification system in a given year, with source for the info (coloured dots in Figs 1 and 2)
files.label: PatentsClassesN.tab

dataFile.description: PatentsClassesN.csv: Number of classes in the historical classification system in a given year, with source for the info (coloured dots in Figs 1 and 2)

files.description:
patents_df.csv: four column file:
1) num0: name of the patent in a seven character format, e.g. the first patent is 0000001
2) class: current main class of the patent
3) num: name of the patent, e.g. the first patent is 1
4) year: year granted
files.label: patents_df.tab

dataFile.description:
patents_df.csv: four column file:
1) num0: name of the patent in a seven character format, e.g. the first patent is 0000001
2) class: current main class of the patent
3) num: name of the patent, e.g. the first patent is 1
4) year: year granted

files.description:
patent-year-ocl-ccl-allcites.csv: five column file
1) patent: patent number
2) gyear: grant year
3) nclass_ocl: original (at birth) main class
4) class: current main class
5) allcites: number of citations received between birth and June 2015.
files.label: patent-year-ocl-ccl-allcites.tab

dataFile.description:
patent-year-ocl-ccl-allcites.csv: five column file
1) patent: patent number
2) gyear: grant year
3) nclass_ocl: original (at birth) main class
4) class: current main class
5) allcites: number of citations received between birth and June 2015.

files.description: yearly_stats.csv : number of patents and current classes classifying these patents granted  on or before a given year. (black line of Figs 1 and 2 in the paper)
files.label: yearly_stats.tab
